oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Truck and 55-gallon drums on Vung Chua Mountain
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A truck that has knocked over several earth-filled 55-gallon drums on which the unit designation has been painted. The truck was unable to stop in heavy rain and slid into the barrels. The barrels and sandbags were set up to defend the entrance to the main facility of the signal station.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mountains; Military facilities; Trucks
Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Vietnam; Qui Nhon (Vietnam)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ammons photographed this incident on Vung Chua Mountain immediately after it occurred. He distinctly remembered seeing the truck sliding in the mud and knocking the barrels over.
